organization.fullName: The First Hospital of Jilin University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy Study of Levofloxacin Combined With Endovascular Thrombectomy for Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Safety and Efficacy Study of Levofloxacin Combined With Endovascular Thrombectomy for Acute Ischemic Stroke Due to Large Vessel Occlusion of Anterior Circulation

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Associated Dean of First Hospital of Jilin University
responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy and safety of levofloxacin combined with endovascular thrombectomy in treating acute ischemic stroke due to large vessel occlusion of anterior circulation.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Acute ischemic stroke is a leading cause of disability and mortality. Emergency thrombectomy is the highest recommended treatment for patients with large vessel occlusion. However, there are still some patients with severe disability or mortality within 90 days after surgery. It is necessary to find new interventions combined to endovascular thrombectomy, which promote the efficacy of endovascular thrombectomy. The investigators' previous studies suggested levofloxacin to be a newly identified neuro-protective agent, which could reduce infarct volume and improve neurologic function in animal models.To evaluate the efficacy and safety of levofloxacin combined with endovascular thrombectomy in treating acute ischemic stroke patients due to large vessel occlusion of anterior circulation, the prospective, multicenter and randomized controlled trial was designed.

armGroups.label: Levofloxacin group
armGroups.description: Levofloxacin 200mg twice per day is administrated.

armGroups.label: Levofloxacin simulant group
armGroups.description: Levofloxacin simulant 200mg twice per day is administrated.

interventions.name: Levofloxacin
interventions.description: Levofloxacin is a quinolone antibiotics and newly identified neuro-protective agent.Endovascular thrombectomy is one of the treatments for acute ischemic stroke.

interventions.name: Levofloxacin simulant
interventions.description: Levofloxacin simulant is placebo.Endovascular thrombectomy is one of the treatments for acute ischemic stroke.

primaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) after 3 days of Levofloxacin/simulant treatment
primaryOutcomes.description: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) ranged from 0 to 42, a low value represents a better outcome.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after 3 days of Levofloxacin/simulant treatment

primaryOutcomes.description: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) ranged from 0 to 42, a low value represents a better outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Hemorrhagic transformation and symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage
secondaryOutcomes.description: defined by computed Tomography (CT) brain scan suggested bleeding, accompanied by an increase in National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) score of ≥4 points.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Infarct volume after 3 days of Levofloxacin/simulant treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: assessed by magnetic resonance imaging brain scan
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: immediately after 3 days of Levofloxacin/simulant treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Modified rankin scale (mRS) score at 30 days
secondaryOutcomes.description: Modified Rankin Scale (mRS), ranged from 0 to 6, a low value represents a better outcome.
Modified Rankin Scale (mRS), ranged from 0 to 6, a low value represents a better outcome.
